meanings.definition: To tilt or turn to one side
meanings.sent1: She cocked her head to the side to listen better.
meanings.sent2: The picture frame was slightly cocked on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The curious puppy cocked its head in confusion at the strange noise.
meanings.sent4: The ship cocked to the left as the strong wind pushed against it.
meanings.sent5: He cocked the book slightly to read the title on the spine.

meanings.definition: To set the hammer of a firearm in a partially cocked position
meanings.sent1: The cowboy cocked his gun before entering the saloon.
meanings.sent2: He carefully cocked the rifle before taking aim at the target.
meanings.sent3: The detective cocked his gun dramatically in the movie scene.
meanings.sent4: She cocked the pistol, ready for the shooting competition.
meanings.sent5: The soldier quickly cocked his weapon in preparation for battle.

meanings.definition: To raise or lift up in a jaunty or bold manner
meanings.sent1: She cocked her chin up defiantly in response to the criticism.
meanings.sent2: The actor cocked his hat at a rakish angle for the role.
meanings.sent3: The little boy cocked his toy sword like a brave knight.
meanings.sent4: The model cocked her hip to the side for the fashion show pose.
meanings.sent5: He cocked his eyebrow in surprise at the unexpected news.
